alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 8:44AM CDT until May 08 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Wapsipinicon River near De Witt 4S affecting Scott and Clinton Counties. For the Wapsipinicon River...including Independence, Anamosa Shaw Rd, De Witt 4S...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wapsipinicon River near De Witt 4S. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flood Stage. Water affects County Road E63 north of the river near Toronto and affects the lowest roads in Buena Vista. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 8.4 feet by next Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
